DataElement.preferredName: Patient Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor Biochemical Pathway Prior Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating a patient meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial regarding the administration of prior therapy affecting the VEGF pathway.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor Biochemical Pathway Prior Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._There are three signaling VEGF receptors. The VEGF family members PIGF and VEGF-B with exclusive binding capacities to the VEGFR-1 can influence monocyte activation and differentiation. The VEGFR-2 and VEGFR-3 binding VEGF homologues, VEGF-C and VEGF-D, are mitogens for both vascular and lymphatic endothelial cells. The orf virus encoded VEGF-E homologue binds and activates only the VEGFR-2 and thus may be the prototype of a vascular endothelial cell-specific growth factor.  Further specific activities of VEGF and its homologues result from receptor-specific signaling and differential expression of ligands or receptors. A naturally occurring soluble form of the VEGFR-1 suggests a regulatory role for this receptor._A series of biochemical reactions which occurs in a known sequence and can result in all or part of the initiation, progression or completion of a biological process or function._An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor Biochemical Pathway Prior Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: There are three signaling VEGF receptors. The VEGF family members PIGF and VEGF-B with exclusive binding capacities to the VEGFR-1 can influence monocyte activation and differentiation. The VEGFR-2 and VEGFR-3 binding VEGF homologues, VEGF-C and VEGF-D, are mitogens for both vascular and lymphatic endothelial cells. The orf virus encoded VEGF-E homologue binds and activates only the VEGFR-2 and thus may be the prototype of a vascular endothelial cell-specific growth factor.  Further specific activities of VEGF and its homologues result from receptor-specific signaling and differential expression of ligands or receptors. A naturally occurring soluble form of the VEGFR-1 suggests a regulatory role for this receptor.:A series of biochemical reactions which occurs in a known sequence and can result in all or part of the initiation, progression or completion of a biological process or function.:An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: There are three signaling VEGF receptors. The VEGF family members PIGF and VEGF-B with exclusive binding capacities to the VEGFR-1 can influence monocyte activation and differentiation. The VEGFR-2 and VEGFR-3 binding VEGF homologues, VEGF-C and VEGF-D, are mitogens for both vascular and lymphatic endothelial cells. The orf virus encoded VEGF-E homologue binds and activates only the VEGFR-2 and thus may be the prototype of a vascular endothelial cell-specific growth factor.  Further specific activities of VEGF and its homologues result from receptor-specific signaling and differential expression of ligands or receptors. A naturally occurring soluble form of the VEGFR-1 suggests a regulatory role for this receptor.
A series of biochemical reactions which occurs in a known sequence and can result in all or part of the initiation, progression or completion of a biological process or function.
Prior action or administration of therapeutic agents that produced an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received prior tr
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment affecting the VEGF pathway in the recurrent setting, including but not limited to thalidomide, bevacizumab, sunitinib, or sorafenib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: eligibility checklist question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment affecting the VEGF pathway in the recurrent setting, including but not limited to thalidomide, sunitinib, pazopanib, sorafenib or nintedanib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior treatment affecting the VEGF/VEGFR pathway or the angiopoietin pathway in the recurrent setting (including, but not limited to thalidomide, bevacizumab, sunitinib, sorafenib, pazopanib, cediranib, nintedanib and trebananib)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with agents targeting the VEGF pathway, including bevacizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment affecting the VEGF pathway, including but not limited to thalidomide, bevacizumab, sunitinib, or sorafenib?
